about.summary: A collection of matrix functions for teaching and learning matrix linear algebra as used in multivariate statistical methods. These functions are mainly for tutorial purposes in learning matrix algebra ideas using R. In some cases, functions are provided for concepts available elsewhere in R, but where the function call or name is not obvious. In other cases, functions are provided to show or demonstrate an algorithm. In addition, a collection of functions are provided for drawing vector diagrams in 2D and 3D.

name: r-matlib
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.9.2' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-matlib
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/matlib_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/matlib/matlib_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 47f02ca1b987b3a68c2f051218c3edd08ee10e47d98885439aabd8dc3cd34e25

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{posix}}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-car
    - r-rgl
    - r-xtable
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-mass
    - r-car
    - r-rgl
    - r-xtable

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('matlib')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('matlib')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/friendly/matlib
  license: GPL (>= 2)
  summary: A collection of matrix functions for teaching and learning matrix linear algebra as
    used in multivariate statistical methods. These functions are mainly for tutorial
    purposes in learning matrix algebra ideas using R. In some cases, functions are
    provided for concepts available elsewhere in R, but where the function call or name
    is not obvious. In other cases, functions are provided to show or demonstrate an
    algorithm. In addition, a collection of functions are provided for drawing vector
    diagrams in 2D and 3D.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - npavlovikj

# Package: matlib
# Type: Package
# Title: Matrix Functions for Teaching and Learning Linear Algebra and Multivariate Statistics
# Version: 0.9.2
# Date: 2019-05-12
# Authors@R: c(person(given = "Michael", family = "Friendly", role=c("aut", "cre"), email="friendly@yorku.ca", comment=c(ORCID="0000-0002-3237-0941")), person(given = "John", family = "Fox", role="aut"), person(given = "Phil", family = "Chalmers", role="aut"), person(given = "Georges", family = "Monette", role="ctb"), person(given = "Gaston", family = "Sanchez", role="ctb") )
# Maintainer: Michael Friendly <friendly@yorku.ca>
# Description: A collection of matrix functions for teaching and learning matrix linear algebra as used in multivariate statistical methods. These functions are mainly for tutorial purposes in learning matrix algebra ideas using R. In some cases, functions are provided for concepts available elsewhere in R, but where the function call or name is not obvious. In other cases, functions are provided to show or demonstrate an algorithm. In addition, a collection of functions are provided for drawing vector diagrams in 2D and 3D.
# License: GPL (>= 2)
# URL: https://github.com/friendly/matlib
# BugReports: https://github.com/friendly/matlib/issues
# LazyData: TRUE
# Suggests: knitr, rglwidget, rmarkdown, carData
# Imports: xtable, MASS, rgl, car, methods
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.1
# Encoding: UTF-8
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-05-29 16:24:15 UTC; Friendly
# Author: Michael Friendly [aut, cre] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-3237-0941>), John Fox [aut], Phil Chalmers [aut], Georges Monette [ctb], Gaston Sanchez [ctb]
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-05-29 17:10:07 UTC
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.6.15
